thread.title: Former Simpsons cartoonist doodles Homer and Marge in guest book in Belize
thread.title_full: Former Simpsons cartoonist doodles Homer and Marge in guest book in Belize | Daily Mail Online

author: Katie Amey for MailOnline
title: Former Simpsons cartoonist doodles Homer and Marge in guest book in Belize
text:
11 shares 4
View
comments
Now this is a seriously incredible message to leave in a hotel guestbook.
Alex Ruiz, a former assistant director on the television programme The Simpsons, drew an amazing illustration of Homer and Marge enjoying a beach holiday on July 17.
'We love Thatch Caye,' he scrawled under the charming doodle.
The illustration left in the Thatch Caye guestbook by former assistant director Alex Ruiz
Thatch Caye is a luxury resort in Belize, where, undoubtedly, Marge and Homer would have a great deal of fun in the sun - as evidenced by their beach get-ups and wide grins.
 Next Posh McDonald's! Fast-food chain opens luxury pop-up in... 'To be alone in a stretch limo? Very sad': Jet-setting DJs... Is this the best free gift in the skies? KLM business class... Brighton is set to become first UK city to ban smoking on... 11 shares The private island is an all-inclusive complex complete with over-water bungalows and island cabanas.
The image was first posted on Reddit by Alex's girlfriend, along with the message: 'When you are a former Simpsons animator and you go on vacation you always leave a doodle in the guestbook.'
Thatch Caye is a luxury all-inclusive resort in Belize, complete with over-water bungalows and island cabanas
She also added that the two of them had 'an absolutely wonderful stay.'
Alex first began his career at The Simpsons, but has since worked on Avatar and Family Guy.
He is currently a freelance illustrator.
Read more: When you're a former Simpsons animator and you go on vacation, you always leave a doodle in the guestbook. : pics
